mcm.utils
Class Dice

java.lang.Object
  mcm.utils.Dice

public class Dice
extends java.lang.Object

Dice contains convenience methods to generate random numbers/colors/points/... All methods are based on the Math.random() method from the java.lang package.

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

Method Summary
static java.awt.Color throwColor()
          Chooses a random opaque RGB Color.
static java.awt.Color throwColor(java.awt.Color notThis)
          Chooses a random opaque RGB Color other than notThis
static double throwDouble(double max)
          Chooses a random double value between zero and max.
static double throwDouble(double min, double max)
          Chooses a random double value from the interval [min, max) if min < max.
static int throwInt(int max)
          Chooses a random int value between zero and max.
static int throwInt(int min, int max)
          Chooses a random integer value from the interval [min, max) if min < max.
static Point throwPoint(Drawable s)
          Chooses a random Point on the given Drawable.

Method Detail

throwColor

public static java.awt.Color throwColor()
Chooses a random opaque RGB Color.

Returns:
the chosen Color

throwColor

public static java.awt.Color throwColor(java.awt.Color notThis)
Chooses a random opaque RGB Color other than notThis

Parameters:
notThis - the 'forbidden' Color
Returns:
return a ramly chosen Color other than notThis

throwDouble

public static double throwDouble(double max)
Chooses a random double value between zero and max. Note that max is never chosen.

Parameters:
max - upper interval bound
Returns:
a random number from
  • the interval [0 - max-1] if max > 0
  • ths interval [0 - max +1] if max < 0
return 0 if max = 0

throwDouble

public static double throwDouble(double min,
                                 double max)
Chooses a random double value from the interval [min, max) if min < max. Note that in this case max is never chosen.
If min = max return min.
Throws a MCMRuntimeException if min > max.

Parameters:
min - lower bound of number range
max - upper bound of number range
Returns:
a random number from the interval [min, max)

throwInt

public static int throwInt(int max)
Chooses a random int value between zero and max. Note that max is never chosen.

Parameters:
max - upper bound
Returns:
a random number
  • the set 0, 1, 2, ..., max-1 if max > 0
  • ths set 0, -1, -2, ..., max +1 if max < 0
return 0 if max = 0

throwInt

public static int throwInt(int min,
                           int max)
Chooses a random integer value from the interval [min, max) if min < max. Note that in this case max is never chosen.
If min = max return min.
Throws a MCMRuntimeException if min > max.

Parameters:
min - lower bound of number range
max - upper bound of number range
Returns:
a random number from the interval [min, max)

throwPoint

public static Point throwPoint(Drawable s)
Chooses a random Point on the given Drawable. The returned point's x,y coordinates are greater equal zero and smaller than s.getWidth() and s.getHeight() respectively.

Parameters:
s - the Drawable for which a random Point is chosen
Returns:
randomly chosen Point
See Also:
Drawable.getHeight(), Drawable.getWidth()
